>>>> lc@... 5/4/2004 3:29:52 AM >>>
>On Mon, 2004-05-03 at =
17:37, Andrew Boyko wrote:
>> I've successfully used a patched version of
>=
> dk.netarkivet.ArcTools.ExtractCDX 
>> to generate Wayback-compliant CDX f=
iles from an Alexa-style DAT file. 
>> My patch is attached, should it be u=
seful to anyone.
>
>Using a Map instead of a Hashtable is the right thing, =
but I don't want
>to have DAT-extracts[1] automatically conform to Wayback =
format.  If it
>was an option flag or a separate method, I'd apply the patc=
h.

There's at least one component of that patch that's a necessary bug fix=
 
to the existing code - in extractFromDat(), the fieldsread.clear() call w=
hen 
the state is set to READ_HEADER is necessary (otherwise fields that 
a=
ppear in earlier records will persist for subsequent records that don't 
ha=
ve that field, which is never right.)  
 
Otherwise, I claim without proof =
that the patch doesn't replace the existing 
ability to choose your own col=
umns in the CDX file; it merely populates 
some of the CDX fields that Wayb=
ack requires and that would be otherwise 
unfilled.   It's certainly possib=
le that I'm wrong about that, though...
 
At any rate, thanks for the code =
* it's been useful for us!
 
Regards, 
Andy Boyko   aboy@...
Library of=
 Congress
